Key Match Events: The Warriors led by 31 points in the first half, but the Rockets tied it with an 18-2 run to open the fourth quarter.
A 3-pointer by Jabari Smith Jr. cut the lead to 119-117 with 15.5 seconds to go in regulation.
Aaron Holiday stole the ball from Draymond Green and he fouled out a few seconds later. Tari Eason made two free throws after that to send it to overtime.
Jonathan Kuminga scored the first two baskets of overtime to make it 123-119. He finished with 23 points.
Post-Match Reflections: The Warriors continued to win without Curry, improving to 5-1 this season. The team said he will be re-evaluated Sunday to see how much longer he’ll be out.
The Rockets played much better after halftime than it did in an awful first half but couldn’t close it out to build on consecutive wins at San Antonio and Dallas.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors scored the first six points in overtime to make it 125-119 and went on to a third straight win without Steph Curry.
The Warriors led by five before the game went into overtime.
Houston made just 1 of 12 shots in overtime.
The Warriors led by 31 points in the first half and it’s Golden State’s 14th straight regular season win over the Rockets and the eighth in a row in Houston.
Others: Andrew Wiggins added 15 points for Golden State in his return after missing two games with a strained back.
Eason led the Rockets with a career-high 27 points. Smith added 21.
